column2: As an Inventory Control Manager, you will oversee and manage the inventory control processes to ensure efficient and accurate inventory management. You will be critical in maintaining optimal inventory levels, minimizing stock discrepancies, and implementing effective inventory control strategies.       Your primary responsibilities will include:       Inventory Management: Developing and implementing inventory management strategies and policies to optimise inventory levels, minimise carrying costs, and meet customer demand.     Ensuring accurate tracking and monitoring of inventory levels, stock movements, and replenishment processes.     Inventory Control Procedures: Establishing and maintaining effective inventory control procedures, including cycle counting, stock reconciliation, and regular physical inventory audits.     Implementing measures to prevent stockouts, overstocks, and obsolete inventory.     Supply Chain Collaboration: Collaborating with suppliers, vendors, and logistics teams to ensure accurate and timely inventory receipt. Managing relationships with suppliers and negotiating favourable terms for inventory procurement.     Demand Planning and Forecasting: Working closely with sales, operations, and procurement teams to develop demand forecasts and inventory replenishment plans.     Analysing sales data, market trends, and customer demand patterns to optimise inventory levels and prevent stock shortages or excesses.     Inventory Accuracy and Reconciliation: Conduct regular inventory reconciliations to ensure accuracy between physical inventory, stock records, and the inventory management system. Investigating and resolving any discrepancies or issues that arise during the reconciliation process.     Inventory Reporting and Analysis: Generating reports and analysing inventory levels, turnover rates, stock movements, and other key performance indicators.     Identifying trends, opportunities, and risks to support data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement.     Process Improvement: Continuously evaluating and improving inventory control processes, systems, and procedures to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and productivity.     Recommending and implementing automation tools and technologies to streamline inventory management processes.     Compliance and Regulatory Requirements: Ensuring compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards related to inventory control, including product labelling, storage, and handling requirements.     Team Management: Leading and supervising a team of inventory control personnel. Providing guidance, training, and coaching to team members to ensure their professional development and optimal performance.     Collaboration and Communication: Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including operations, sales, finance, and IT, to ensure alignment and effective coordination of inventory control activities. Communicating inventory-related information, trends, and insights to relevant stakeholders.       Qualifications and Skills:       Bachelor s degree in Supply Chain Management, Operations Management, Business Administration, or a related field. Relevant certifications     Proven experience in inventory control management, preferably in the technology or system integration industry.     Strong knowledge of inventory management principles, methodologies, and best practices.     Proficiency in using inventory management software and systems.     Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, generate insights, and make data-driven decisions.     Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in inventory tracking and reconciliation.     Strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple tasks and priorities effectively.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.     Leadership skills to manage and develop a team of inventory control personnel.     Problem-solving skills and the ability to identify and implement process improvements.     Knowledge of applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards related to inventory control.
column11: Procurement, Supply chain management, Team management, Sales operations, Analytical, System integration, Inventory control, Forecasting, Monitoring, Logistics

column2: We are looking for an individual who will be a part of the UD Trucks Raw Material controlling team under Purchasing Business control.   As a raw material controller, you will be responsible to provide market impact visibility and contractual guidance to Purchasing function in various material commodities.    Your mission is to create an efficient tracking of raw material adjustments as well as securing the timely completion of the material price validation to ensure business continuity.   Result driven and customer focused mind-set will also be essential for this position.   The individual will drive various raw material related cost optimization activities and to regularly keep a track of various region-wise material Indices along with monitoring of raw material adjustments                Responsibilities and Duties         Serve as Business Partner for purchasing organization.   Drive RM agreements compliance as per market trends within Purchasing.   Ensure that the right RM indexes are used by suppliers and provide support to purchasing team on the same.   Ensure process compliance with internal controls, which includes support to process owners and managers, review and analysis of documentation and other related activities.   Support the PU Business Control team in monthly closing and KPI/PI tracking   Secure subscriptions renewal from appropriates market analysis institutes   Understand suppliers raw material cost structure, supply chains and process technology   Provide historical raw material cost variance analysis to support contractual negotiations   Support Buyers in negotiation and in cost workshop / supply chains activities             Minimum qualifications     Bachelor s in mechanical engineering/ Production Engineering with 3-5 years post qualification experience.   Strong understanding of global economic industry trends.   Proven ability to work independently with minimum oversight and has a track record of meeting deadlines. Flexibility to take on a wide variety of topics and tasks. A positive approach to problem solving. Strong MS office.   Good practical knowledge of various manufacturing process and raw material conversion is essential.   Commercial acumen for understanding the part cost breakdown and various components.   Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence others, build relationships and manage conflicts, both internal and external   Recognizes the importance of networking and a positive working relationship; willingness to learn and share knowledge; values the diversity of ideas.
column11: Automation, Networking, Commercial vehicle, Manufacturing process, Raw material, MS Office, Variance analysis, Automotive, Monitoring, Logistics

column2: About the Role This is a team contribution role to design new materials and primary/secondary packaging for different products being sold on the platform. The position will be responsible for identifying process gaps, new materials innovations and drive the projects from start to finish in alignment with a large set of stakeholders. The role demands deep analytical skill to understand the issues and out of box thinking to solve these issues. About the team Packaging Design for Grocery, Large, Externalization Team works towards designing ecommerce ready packaging solutions for all categories from the sellers and Next Gen packaging solutions for the ecommerce supply chain. This allows us to keep to our values of "customer first". In this competitive scenario, the team also works towards identifying packaging process improvement and automation opportunities to drive efficiency across fulfilment centers. You are Responsible for Packaging Design support for: Sustainability, Grocery, Large Design packaging materials for new product launches with timely execution. Identify improvement opportunities and establish packaging solutions to drive these improvements. Identify and innovate new packaging materials/formats to be futureready (scale, sustainability, fungibility and simplification). Identify and support cost reduction and customer experience Improvement opportunities with regards to Packaging. Create design documents followed by rapid prototyping, operational trials and business case approvals to solve business challenges. Analyze data, draw conclusions to solve problems/ make timely and informed decisions. To succeed in this role  you should have the following Knowledge of all type of Packaging materials, Packing processes, Packaging machinery Latest trends in Packaging materials and Packaging technology Verification and validation protocols for packaging materials Vendor development and audit protocols Regulatory compliances pertaining to packaging materials Design Thinking and Data driven approach towards problem solving Ability to drive project through large set of stakeholders Ability to think through and work under ambiguous situations Analytical in nature and ability to translate strategies into execution Ability to connect with people across teams & levels Strong bias for Action Bachelors Degree in Engineering or related technical stream + Post-Graduation in Packaging 4-6 Years of Experience in Packaging design or related domain Mandatory Skills Packaging Development, Ecommerce packaging, Sustainability Desirable Skills: Ecommerce supply chain
column11: Packaging Design, Packaging Development

column2: Store Incharge Record the store material receipt and consumption on a daily basis. Checking the stock as per records. Receiving materials, stocking, recording of receipts, assisting J.E. to prepare quality reports of the received materials. Issue materials as per the indent for different works. General supervision on the site regarding wastage of material, improper use of material etc. Recollecting any balance/ unused materials at the end of the working days. Handing over of the charge of material lying in the site premises of the night security personal from the day security guards. Update records on display boards and display slates regarding the stock. Prepare fortnightly/ monthly consumption reports jointly with the junior engineers. Prepare a list of excess material. Update the stocks periodically. Inform the concerned engineer of the status of balance material in order to raise further indent.   Purchase Manager - Real Estate Job description Responsible for      managing all purchasing activities related to construction projects. Procurement Strategy and Planning: Develop and implement      procurement strategies aligned with project requirements, quality      standards, and budgetary constraints. Collaborate with      project teams, engineers, and stakeholders to identify procurement needs,      specifications, and delivery schedules. Conduct market research      to identify potential vendors, evaluate their capabilities, and negotiate favourable      terms and conditions. Identify and evaluate      potential suppliers, contractors, and subcontractors, assessing their      reliability, quality, and competitive pricing. Maintain a supplier      database, track supplier performance, and conduct periodic supplier      evaluations. Conduct regular      supplier/vendor performance evaluations and audits. Establish and nurture      strong relationships with vendors, negotiating contracts, resolving      disputes, and managing vendor performance. Prepare and issue purchase orders based on      project requirements, ensuring accuracy, completeness, payment terms, and      compliance with company policies and procedures. Monitor purchase order status, track      deliveries, and address any delays or issues in coordination with vendors      and logistics teams. Oversee inventory levels and stock      availability, ensuring optimal inventory turnover and minimizing excess or      obsolete stock. Collaborate with warehouse and logistics teams      to maintain accurate inventory records, manage storage, and coordinate      efficient material flow. Maintain proper documentation of procurement      activities, including contracts, purchase orders, invoices, and vendor      agreements.

column2: Job Title : Store Assistant Manager Location : Sanand (Gujarat) Company : Hitachi Hi-Rel Power Electronics Private Limited About Us : Hitachi Hi-Rel Power Electronics Pvt. Ltd. ( www.hitachi-hirel.com), reckoned as a PIONEER IN POWER ELECTRONICS. With over 3 decades of experience, we have garnered a significant level of trust in our power electronics market segment and continue to offer world class power electronics products, value added services & customized solutions. World class technology      & innovation from Hitachi, Ltd., Japan State-of-the-art manufacturing facilities at Gandhinagar &      Sanand in Gujarat, India In-house R&D (Research & Development) facility, recognized      by Government of India An ISO 9001:2008, ISO      14001:2004 & BS OHSAS 18001:2007 Certified Company, adhering to world      class quality standards Approved by major consultants and EPC contractors Serving entire gamut of      industries PAN India & global      presence Offer products with      greater energy efficiency & lower carbon footprint  We are the leading manufacturer of power electronics products. Today we offer wide range of UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply) for industrial, commercial & enterprise applications, medium voltage & low voltage variable frequency drives, steel automation and engineered variable frequency drives for customized applications, industrial automation & control products like PLC, SCADA & DCS, grid connected solar inverter, railway inverter and other customized products like UMPS, iDip (dip ride through solutions), etc. We have rich experience in supplying power back-up products & complete customized solutions for mission critical applications in refineries, petro-chemicals, power generation, steel & metal, and process industries as well as critical data processing applications.  Position Overview : We are seeking an experienced and organized Store Assistant Manager to oversee our store and warehouse operations. The ideal candidate will have 6 to 8 years of experience in store handling, warehouse activities, and manpower management. Knowledge of 5S, FIFO, KAIZEN, and other inventory management practices is essential. This role requires strong leadership skills, attention to detail, and the ability to maintain efficient and orderly storage systems. Key Responsibilities : - Assist the Store Manager in overseeing all store and warehouse operations, ensuring efficient and effective management of inventory and resources. - Implement and maintain 5S practices to ensure a clean, organized, and safe working environment. - Manage the First-In-First-Out (FIFO) system to ensure proper inventory rotation and minimize waste. - Apply KAIZEN principles to continuously improve store and warehouse processes, enhancing efficiency and reducing costs. - Supervise and coordinate the activities of store and warehouse staff, including scheduling, training, and performance management. - Ensure accurate and timely recording of inventory transactions, including receipts, issues, returns, and adjustments. - Conduct regular inventory audits and cycle counts to maintain inventory accuracy and resolve discrepancies. - Monitor and manage stock levels to ensure availability of necessary materials and supplies, while minimizing excess inventory. - Collaborate with procurement, production, and logistics teams to align inventory levels with demand and production schedules. - Ensure compliance with safety regulations and company policies, promoting a safe and healthy work environment. - Prepare and present reports on inventory status, warehouse activities, and performance metrics to senior management. - Utilize warehouse management systems and software to track and manage inventory and warehouse operations. Qualifications : - Diploma/B.E./B. Tech. - Power Electronics / Electronics & Communication /Electronics/ Electrical/Mechanical - 6 to 8 years of experience in store handling, warehouse activities, and manpower management. - Strong knowledge of inventory management practices, including 5S, FIFO, and KAIZEN. - Proven experience in supervising and coordinating warehouse staff. - Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities. - Strong attention to detail and accuracy in inventory management. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. - Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make informed decisions in a fast-paced environment. - Knowledge of safety regulations and best practices in warehouse operations. Benefits : - Salary best in industry - Healthy work environment -Medical and accidental insurance - Transportation and canteen facilities - Spot reward and recognition How to Apply:  Kindly forward your updated CV on  careers@hitachi-hirel.com This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the position and is not an exhaustive list of skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities, or working conditions associated with it. Management may modify or change the duties and other job requirements at any time.

column2: Material Planning: Forecasting material requirements based on production schedules and project timelines. Collaborating with production and procurement teams to ensure accurate material needs are met. Procurement: Sourcing and purchasing materials and supplies. Negotiating with suppliers to obtain the best terms, including pricing, delivery schedules, and payment terms. Developing and maintaining relationships with key suppliers. Inventory Management: Monitoring and managing inventory levels to ensure optimal stock without overstocking or stockouts. Implementing inventory control systems to track and manage inventory efficiently. Conducting regular audits to ensure inventory accuracy. Logistics and Distribution: Coordinating the transportation and delivery of materials to ensure timely arrival. Managing warehouse operations, including the receipt, storage, and dispatch of materials. Ensuring compliance with safety and regulatory standards in material handling and storage. Supplier Management: Evaluating and selecting suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost-effectiveness. Monitoring supplier performance and addressing any issues related to quality or delivery. Cost Control: Monitoring material costs and identifying cost-saving opportunities. Preparing budgets and financial reports related to material management. Implementing cost-control measures to optimize material usage and reduce waste. Quality Assurance: Ensuring that all materials meet the required quality standards. Coordinating with the quality control team to address any material defects or discrepancies. Documentation and Reporting: Maintaining accurate records of material transactions, including purchases, receipts, and usage. Preparing reports on material status, inventory levels, and procurement activities. Ensuring compliance with all relevant documentation requirements. Process Improvement: Identifying and implementing process improvements to enhance efficiency in material management. Utilizing technology and software solutions to streamline material management processes. Collaboration and Communication: Working closely with other departments such as production, procurement, finance, and logistics to ensure smooth material flow. Communicating effectively with team members, suppliers, and stakeholders to resolve any issues related to material management. Preferred candidate profile  - ITI Candidate preferred Perks and benefits   ESI EPF
